item.title: A beginner's guide to the Elixir programming language
item.description: In this section, we will cover: What is Elixir? Key features, tools, and uses of Elixir Intro to Elixir functional programming Simple code snippets What is Elixir? linkElixir is a general-purpose, functional, concurrent programming language designed for building applications that are reliable, scalable, and easy to maintain. Tt looks a lot like Ruby but offers features that help with handling lots of tasks at the same time (concurrency), recovering from errors quickly (fault tolerance), and low latency.

item.title: Create A Simple Web Server using Elixir
item.description: In this lesson, we will build a simple HTTP server from scratch using the PlugCowboy Elixir library. Cowboy is a simple HTTP server for Erlang and Plug will provide us with a connection adapter for the web server. Getting started linkAssuming you already have Elixir installed, we will start a simple project by running the command: mix new server --sup cd server Note that server is the name of your project, and you can name it however you want.
